sentences.sentence: Everyone smiles in the same language
sentences.author: Proverb

sentences.sentence: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage
sentences.author: Anais Nin

sentences.sentence: If you don’t like something, change it. If you can’t change it, change your attitude.
sentences.author: Maya Angelou

sentences.sentence: Trusting our intuition often saves us from disaster.
sentences.author: Anne Wilson Schae

sentences.sentence: Truth is powerful and it prevails.
sentences.author: Sojourner Truth

sentences.sentence: Do one thing every day that scares you
sentences.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

sentences.sentence: Light tomorrow with today!
sentences.author: Elizabeth Browning

sentences.sentence: Society develops wit, but its contemplation alone forms genius.
sentences.author: Madame de Stael

sentences.sentence: Without faith, nothing is possible. With it, nothing is impossible.
sentences.author: Mary Bethune

sentences.sentence: Rainbows apologize for angry skies.
sentences.author: Sylvia Voirol

sentences.sentence: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.
sentences.author: Annie Dillard

sentences.sentence: From little acorns mighty oaks do grow.
sentences.author: American proverb

sentences.sentence: Life is a process. We are a process. The universe is a process.
sentences.author: Anne Schaef

sentences.sentence: Kind words will unlock an iron door.
sentences.author: Turkish proverb

sentences.sentence: Nothing in life is to be feared. It is only to be understood.
sentences.author: Marie Curie

sentences.sentence: Keep yourself to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadow.
sentences.author: Helen Keller

sentences.sentence: I don't believe in failure. It is not failure if you enjoyed the process.
sentences.author: Oprah Winfrey

sentences.sentence: I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning how to sail my ship.
sentences.author: Louisa Alcott

sentences.sentence: Your worst enemy cannot harm you as much as your own unguarded thoughts.
sentences.author: Buddha

sentences.sentence: Nothing in life is to be feared. It is only to be understood.
sentences.author: Marie Curie

sentences.sentence: Set your life on fire. Seek those who fan your flames.
sentences.author: Rumi

sentences.sentence: To fly, we have to have resistance.
sentences.author: Maya Lin

sentences.sentence: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world right in the eye.
sentences.author: Helen Keller

sentences.sentence: I'd rather regret the things that I have done than the things that I have not done.
sentences.author: Lucille Ball

sentences.sentence: Intuition is the discriminant faculty that enables you to decide which of two lines of reasoning is right.
sentences.author: Paramahansa Yogananda
